ContentHubItem.name: ContentHubItem
ContentHubItem.description: Represents a file or folder in a Files Connect external data source, such as Microsoft SharePoint or OneDrive for Business.

ContentHubRepositoryId.description: The ID for the related external data source described by the ContentHubRepository object.

ContentItemSize.description: The size of the file or folder. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

ContentModifiedDate.description: Date the file or folder content last changed.

ContentSize.description: The size of the file or folder that's less than 2 GB.

Description.description: Explanation of item in external data source.

ExternalContentUrl.description: The URL of the document content in the external data source.

ExternalDocumentUrl.description: The URL of the detail page in the external data source.

ExternalId.description: ID for the file or folder in the external data source.

FileExtension.description: File format extension, such as .doc or .pdf

FileType.description: Complete file type, such as “Microsoft Word Document.”

IsFolder.description: Indicates whether item is a folder or file.

Name.description: Name of the file or folder in the external data source.

Owner.description: Username of the content owner in the external data source.

ParentId.description: The ID of the parent folder for the record.This field isn’t returned in queries or searches of the ContentHubItem object. It supports only WHERE clauses, such as the following: WHERE ContentHubRepositoryId = <ID of external source> and ParentId = <ID of parent folder or record>. Or specify WHERE ParentId = <name of root folder> to return the children of the root folder. Tip The ParentId field supports both Salesforce IDs (in the format “0CHxxx”) and external IDs.

Title.description: The title that appears in the content, which often differs from the Name of the containing file or folder.

UpdatedBy.description: Username for the person who last updated the file.
